result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon James Donley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM215 and 15TR1876:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Brandon James Donley appeared. Case called at 9:49 a.m. ADA McKinley states there is a joint recommendation. Recites agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUIlTY to Ct 1 in 15CM215. DE pleads GUILTY to 15TR1876. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct  in 15CM215 and GUILTY of 15TR1876. Sentencing arguments. ADA McKinley states victims rights have been complied with. No DNA Sample or Surcharge. 20 days to appeal. Crt orders:

- In case 15TR1876, $250.00 forfeiture inclusive of costs. Would like to set up a payment plan.
In case 15CM215:

- S/W 1 year probation. Report to probation no later than 3:00 p.m. today.  3 days jail credit if probation is revoked. 

- $500.00 fine inclusive of costs. To be paid over the course of probation.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Brady Khalar and Jarl Khalar. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Pre-trial conference at 10-16-2015 09:45 am
